summary:
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

Recalling previous resolutions and statements on Sudan and South Sudan, welcomes progress on the Joint Border Verification and Monitoring Mechanism (JBVMM) but notes measures are not yet fully achieved.

The Council:

1. Extends UNISFA's mandate modification until 15 October 2018, which will be the final extension unless parties take specific measures.
2. Maintains UNISFA's authorized troop ceiling of 4,791 until 15 October 2018, then reduces to 4,250 unless the mandate is extended.

Parties must demonstrate progress on:

- Allowing UNISFA and JBVMM freedom of movement
- Finalizing JBVMM team sites and Ad Hoc Committee meeting
- Convening JPSM meetings and withdrawing from the Safe Demilitarized Border Zone (SDBZ)
- Establishing border crossing corridors and opening additional corridors
- Holding Joint Border Commission and Joint Demarcation Committee meetings

The Secretary-General must report on progress by 15 September 2018. The Council remains actively seized of this matter.
